Good one. I didn't read book 1 but i don't think i miss anything. What makes it great is the logic is leaning on reality, not your normal hentai with a fake psychology logic. The ending could be better tho, glasses guy doesn't want to leave any regrets about the "game" which he wants to make her fall completely before he left... would be better if the glasses guy came back only to find the woman he tried to ruin get a happy ending after all he did. He lose the 'game' but he thinks he won. Well overall it's good!

red_skies as the saying goes judge them through their actions  than words...If she cared for their collective future then firstly she would had reported the rape than bask in the depravity ...She didnt show real concern for him even once rather was  all aboard the infedility train right since the beginning..Only thing which prevented her from being upfront was the ulterior motive of the glasses guy.Her frustration comes from being constantly reminded of her wrong by settling with the dude she supposedly loved  and dumped than acknowledging his pain..
BZo1480 the apology is having to go down the ladder to whom she never gave two shit about..A girl would know within second trimester that she's pregnant....There's no happy end except the girl

I get everyone's frustrations with Ryouta not dumping Fumi, but Aki had already done the opposite in MUSA, so I doubt that he was going to do it again even if it made more sense than what he ended up doing here. Also, it's kinda funny that both Ryouta and the dude from MUSA ended up being sexless in the end(MUSA dude got ED, Ryouta not being able to get past what he saw on the camera). Now, while Fumi still managed to get Ryouta to accept her back, to say that she's suffering no consequences is kinda wrong. She's constantly apologizing, Ryouta won't even touch her anymore, and there's still the physical representation of her infidelity to remind both of them of the choice she made. The relationship is basically living on borrowed time since Ryouta will never trust her ever again no matter how much she apologizes.
I really love the thoughts of regrets of the girls and how her fce just paralize at the end if only the guy just walk away after confronting her it would have been perfect.
hate the ending no revenge on the guy

This one really stuck with me, I know the author ends it here but that leaves room for us to imagine how we'd like it to continue. I imagined that Ryouta broke up with Fumi after the baby is born and maybe 6 months old. He can't get the image of what they did out of his mind. It's one thing if she made a mistake once but she gave that other guy everything. The two of them slept together every night together in each other's arms like real lovers. She gave him her heart and all the things the leads held dear like the camera and lipstick she defiled the memory by using it with Okaya during sex. I mean the other guy even puts a ring on her, the coke can. I mean he has to remember that shit constantly cause he saw all the stuff they loved destroyed, his girl preferring another man's embrace, he saw it on tape, plus a constant reminder in the shape of the other guy's kid. That's too much stuff that I imagined that he'd leave her with some money and tearfully leave.
@DRNTR Idiot, people want some sense of realism in their stories. Suspension of disbelief can only be stretched so thin.

In the end, the girl, for a while at least, was constantly reminded by the decisions her boyfriend took for (t)he(i)r sake but that meant taking one step away from his dreams that everything was her sole fault, so I guess we could not argue that everything was just fun and giggles for her after pulling that on him. Him deciding to stay with her was, in certain sense, her punishment; however, whether it was a light punishment for her or not, that's something different.

To love someone is to accept all of them... mistakes and guilts. Hindrances in life, after tearing them apart, bring them closer even more and deepen their love. It's a beautiful story, given that ending. Salute to the author.

Why is it that when women cheat they most of the time get away with it even when they get pregnant, and when men cheat they suffer a huge loss of everything? They lose their wife, respect, property, and sometimes even their children. For the rest of their life will be branded with a sinner's stigma and their misdeed will spread like wildfire. Sometimes that man didn't even cheat and unjustly suffers... The world just isn't fair...
